column1: Warner walks at him, he delivers a bumper and Warner ducks
back of a length, on off, he's back and defending to cover-point but the fielder closes in to prevent one
cut beautifully forward of point! Fractionally short and wide, the pitch is a lovely pace, he leaned back and placed it nicely forward of point
135kph, back of a length, angled in, he's cramped jumping back to defend
136kph, good length angled in, he gets half forward and gets a thick inside edge onto pad. Shami appealed but Warner clearly hit it
142kph fuller and wider, Warner leans onto a square drive and times it beautifully, but straight to point
141kph, good length, angled into off, he leans forward and pushes firmly to mid off
140kph, back of a length, on off, he's back and working to forward square
135kph back of a length, outside off, he's back and defending to cover
good length, angled in, he is jumping back and defending from the crease
144kph, full outside off, he drives firmly to mid off
back of a length, off stump, he's back and defending to point
138kph, shorter into the hip, he's back and tucking this forward of square with just a push but times it well enough to get two
140kph short ball, surprises Warner in terms of bounce, he pulls awkwardly and gets a thick top edge that flies safely over square leg
141kph, good length, top of off, he defends from the crease
138kph, fuller, he flashes a drive and gets a thick edge that flies safely well wide of slip down to third man
good length, fourth stump, he walks down and defends to mid off
139kph, angled down leg, he glances to fine leg to get off the mark
146kph, back of a length, into the thigh pad, he tried to pull but it comes off the thigh guard and they get a leg bye
141kph, full on leg, he works this off the pads to midwicket and they pinch a quick single
141kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he pushes on the front foot to cover
chipped just over midwicket! It was mistimed off a slight leading edge, Kohli was tight at midwicket and it just went over his head for a couple
thumped off the pads behind square! Didn't chip this. Too full and straight and Finch glanced it powerfully behind square
142kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and cutting to point
pulled over square leg! A drag down short ball first up, Warner waits back and picks this up easily, depositing it over the rope with a controlled pull shot
swing and a miss. 139kph, fuller length, he tried to launch down the ground but it swung away late to beat the edge
142kph, good length, angled into off, he's back and working this behind square to the sweeper in the deep
141kph, he tries to drive on the up wide of off, gets a thick edge to short fine
144kph, good length outside off, he walks down and defends with soft hands to cover-point and they pinch one
143kph, back of a length on leg, he's back and turning this around the corner to fine leg
136kph, good length, angled into off, he defends to cover
139kph, short ball, he tries to pull but it holds in the surface a touch, he mistimes a pull off the toe to midwicket
139kph, good length angled to the top of off, he defends half forward
140kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes on the front foot firmly to cover-point
139kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and pushing this into the gap at point
141kph, full on off, he slices a pushed drive to mid off and takes on Kohli! What running! Very brave. Kohli was in quickly and the throw was sharp but Finch beat him
139kph, full outside off, Finch sets himself back and just drives with his hands wide of mid off
141kph, good length, angled into middle, he defends from the crease
lofted straight of mid off! It was a full delivery floated up outside off, he swings through the line, doesn't nail but hits it well enough to find the rope
141kph, bouncer, he pulls as he moved his head out of the way and slaps it forward of square and they run brilliantly for two
What a shot! Backing away and smashes this past cover! It was good length angled into the top of middle, he backed away and slapped it between cover and mid off. This pitch is very good to bat on
bouncer high over Warner's head and called wide
142kph, shorter length, he's back and running this with control to short third man
back of a length, nipping in, he's walking forward and getting hit on the thigh pad, it rolls to short third man
good length, 141kph, top of middle, he tucks this around the corner to fine leg
139kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
140kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
brilliant pull shot wide of mid on! Fractionally short, angled in, Warner stands up and plays a short arm jab, thumping it wide of mid on
short and wide and cut up and over point! They just brought deep point up in the circle and then he dragged it wide, Warner was sitting and waiting and lifted it over point
back of a length outside off, he's back and defending to cover
140kph, bouncer, very high. Finch doesn't need to duck and it was a tough take for Rahul. Called wide
back of a length, 141kph, on off, he's back and working this to midwicket, Kohli misfields as they pinch one
143kph, full on off, he checks his stroke, defending to mid off
138kph, bouncer, over leg, he ducks under it
145kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and defending to midwicket, Warner quickly sends Finch back. He was ready to go but Pandya zipped in
143kph, angled in, straightening, Warner gets a slight leading edge but it flies safely into the off side
Finch charges and lifts over wide mid off! 141kph, length ball wide of off, but finch's movement turned it into a volley and he lifted it over wide mid off with ease
147kph, good length on middle, he hangs back this time and drives firmly to mid on
just short of Jadeja at backward point! 143kph, short and fractionally wide. Finch cuts but it's tight to him and he slices it in the air but it just bounces short of Jadeja
back of a length angled in, he tries to turn behind square but gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad and it rolls into the off side for one
144kp, cracking yorker, fourth stump line, Warner is beaten and it goes past off stump! Not far away. Great delivery
short and wide, 144kph, he cuts in the air through a vacant backward point, the sweeper has to get around to cut it off
full on middle, he drives to long on
slog sweep into the midwicket crowd! Wow. Leg break, tossed up in the slot, he got down on one knee and took no notice of the man at deep midwicket, he hit in 15 rows back!
short and wide, over-compensation, Warner slaps a cut through cover-point! Easy pickings
87kph, good leg break on off, Warner mistimes a drive to Chahal
87kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this off his toes. 50 to Warner off just 39 balls. He has been superb so far.
drifting into leg, it slides on and hits the pad, there's a polite appeal but no conviction. It was sliding down and India knew it
fuller on off, he pushes a drive back to Saini
142kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and late cutting, controlling the bounce to third man, Warner pushed for two but slipped
yorker length outside off, he squeezes this out to point
144kph, good length, on off, he pushes this from the crease to mid off
146kph, high full toss hits him in the stomach! Finch doubles over in pain. But he's OK.It's a no-ball
Finch swings hard backing away at a shorter length ball but misses by a mile
good bouncer but Finch gets a top edge trying to hook and it flies safely fine of fine leg! A bit unlucky for Saini
shorter leg break, he's down low and pulling to square leg
88kph, slider out of the front of the hand, Finch stays leg side to drive but mistimes and drags to midwicket
good length, 90kph, he skips down and drives to long on
shorter length, he's back and punching to long on
92kph, fuller and quicker outside off, he charges but has to jump outside off to get his pad in the way to block it
full on leg, he clips this firmly through forward square to the sweeper
144kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending this to cover-point for a single
141kph, short ball into the ribs, he tried to avoid it and got hit on the gloves, taking his eyes off it, it rolls behind square
short ball, Finch pulls powerfully with the angle behind square and beats fine leg! He did takes his eyes off it but nailed it
chipped just over Kohli at cover! This wasn't in control but he lifted a backfoot drive over cover
half volley, 145kph, he set his firm and caressed a glorious cover drive! Beautiful shot
142kph, back of a length on off, Finch is back and defending

Warner might be run out here due to a horror mix up! He just got home! So close. He pushed to cover and called yes but was rightly sent back, the throw was right over the bails and Rahul whipped them off quickly but Warner's full length dive got him home by inches
slower leg break, he's back and working this off the pads to deep square
shorter outside off, 91kph, he punches off the back foot to cover but he mistimed it
89kph, good length on leg, he sits back and works this to the gap square of midwicket
tossed up, he drives straight to cover
88kph, pushed through, he defends with the full face into the on side
93kph. tossed up on middle, he drives back to the bowler
drifting into leg, he paddle sweeps fine but didn't get it well
tossed up on middle, he pushes back to the bowler
floated up on leg, he chips this in the air towards long on but short of the man
shorter length, 94kph, he stands up and punches to long on
fuller outside off, he sits back though and punches this on the up past cover and they will get a couple
shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this to midwicket
full outside off, he drives to long off, Warner wants two but it's not on
flatter quicker one, on middle, he drives to long on
lofted just over long on's head! Powerful shot. It was tossed up, he skipped down and launched it flat but got enough of it to beat the man on the rope who jumped up. It was too high for him
flatter on middle, he's back and working to midwicket
yorker on middle, he jams it
length on off, and a misfield at cover means they get an extra run. Kohli the fielder
length on off, pushed to short cover
reverse sweep, but doesn't get hold of it. Short third man fields easily
skips down the track and gets to the pitch to flick it off his pads but can't beat midwicket
angling into him, makes room and cuts through point staying legside of the ball
fullish on the pads, flicked to short fine leg
fullish and spinning into him, tucked through square
down the track but this was bowled flatter and quicker, and shorter, so he can't quite get to the pitch. Bunts it back down the pitch
and down the track again, gets to the pitch that time but the ball's dipping a bit on him and he can't time his drive. Toe ends it to the ground and then to extra cover
stays in his crease this time and clips it comfortably to long-on
length ball spinning into him, punched back, not timed
flatter and quicker outside off, pushed back to the bowler's left
floated up on a length outside off, slapped to deep cover
marginally shorter, Warner goes back to pull but gets it towards the end of his bat and mistimes it to mid-off
goes for the reverse sweep because it's full on leg, but doesn't get it cleanly. Ball loops up off glove behind the keeper
worked to short fine leg
a few steps down the track and flicks off his pads again, but again straight to short fine
good length, tight line outside off, nudged to backward point
fuller outside off, driven to long-on
tossed up, he skips down the track and punches to long-off
nicely done by Warner. Too full and straying on the pads, Warner sweeps it fine with full control. He had to beat short fine leg, and did it easily
length on the stumps, clipped to long-on
full-blooded drive to a tossed up full ball outside off, but hit straight to Kohli at short cover
boom. That's vintage Finch and a great way to raise his fifty. Tossed up too full outside off, he gets down on one knee and slams it over deep midwicket
length on leg stump, nudged away through square
fuller on the stumps, pushed to wide long-on
length on the stumps, pushed gently to long-on
fuller on the pads, worked through backward square leg
darted on leg, he misses the flick
looked to launch that over long-on but doesn't time it that well and it bounces to the man on the boundary there
good length outside off, punched towards extra cover
smacked. That is superbly done by Finch. Marginally short by Shami, and he transfers weight back and pivots to nail this pull shot to deep midwicket
came on to him a bit quicker, Finch was looking to swivel-pull again, gets it finer than he intended, but the fine leg is squarer so they get two
length outside off, steered to backward point

caught at extra cover. Good bowling by Shami, he was brought back for the breakthrough and gets it. Full ball tailing into him, it's a yorker almost and Finch is off balance while trying to flick it off his toes. Gets a leading edge that loops up for an easy catch
yorker first up on leg stump, Smith's moving across, nudges it to square leg
length on the stumps, punched to long-on
steps down the track and defends this into the offside
given some more air this time, Smith stays in his crease and strokes it through point
looped up on the stumps, pushed to short midwicket
flatter on leg stump, nudged to midwicket again
flatter and shorter, he goes back and works this backward of square
back of a length angling into him on off, steered to short third man's right, who does well to dive and stop it
too full and on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
banged in short, he stays in his crease to pull, didn't really go properly back on that so it goes off the top edge, but lands safely, well clear of deep square leg
class from Smith. Was going for the yorker but it's not quite there, and Smith moves back and across to drive this bullet straight, back past the bowler
length on off, stays still at the point of contact and works it through square
fuller on a fourth stump line angling into him from around the wicket, driven hard into the ground and straight to short cover
length outside off, Smith stretches his front foot forward and pushes with his bat in front to long-off
length, stump to stump, goes across and clips this through square leg

Warner might be run out here. He pushed hard for two, it was his call, and he made the dive too, but the man at long-off scored a superb direct hit. And he's out. That's a bit of luck, there was no need to push for that second. Shreyas Iyer the fielder, who's done really well running in quickly and releasing the ball fast. The ball was on a length, held up a bit and Smith was into his chip a bit early. That meant the ball went in the air slowly before bouncing to Iyer. That made Warner think of the second, he pushed Smith for it. Costly call.
length on the stumps, goes back and pushes through square
fuller on the pads, worked to short fine leg
length outside off, gently pushed to short cover
shot!. Loosener from Bumrah, wide and short, and Smith stays still and punches through point by opening his bat face. The ball fairly raced off the bat, such great timing
clipped through midwicket
length ball nipping into him with the angle, patted back to the bowler
length on a fifth stump, steered to third man
length outside off, defended towards point
fuller on off, he's moving across so ends up picking this off his pads through square leg
goes on the front foot and works it through square. Soft hands and no fielder there so they can sprint back for two
fuller on off, uses wrists to try to drive this to the bowler's left but Jadeja dives and stops it
goes back and whips this through midwicket
length on middle and leg, flicked off the back foot to deep midwicket
extra bounce. On a length and he was a bit surprised by the bounce, had to loosen wrists and let the ball plop back on the ground off the high part of the bat, defending it
length on the stumps, worked to midwicket
nipping into him a tad, back of a length, punched through cover
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and steers to point
back of a length, keeps it close to off, Smith stays beside it and opens the face to run it to third man
length outside off, he's pushing inside the line and it takes the edge to go to third man. The fielder is a bit square so has to run to his left to gather
length outside off, moving across and flicks to deep square
goes for the yorker, but it's a low full toss, bunted to mid-on for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, comes on the front foot to work to midwicket
outstanding by Smith. Made a hint of room to a full ball on off, and threaded the gap through cover beautifully. Timed it superbly too, as it runs all the way to the boundary

risky run. Not the best idea after a run out already. This was pushed to cover and they set off, Marnus had to put in a full -length dive. Might have still been tight with a direct hit, but the fielder was rushing in and let the ball go while horizontal
steered through square
bang. Spots the length so early does Smith. Fuller and he takes a big stride, goes down on one knee and unleashes a slog sweep to perfection. Ball goes several rows back over midwicket
straight bat to long-on for a single to retain strike
back of a length outside off, punched to point
back of a length outside off, cuts it to deep point
attempted yorker turned low full toss, driven back past the bowler off the outside half of the bat. Mid on fields
length on the stumps, uses wrists to flick this backward of square

elegance. Smith is in some unbelievable form. Full on off, he's moving across but is always so still at the point of contact, drives this very straight, to the bowler's right and it races to the boundary
and now touch to follow class. Moving across again, this ends up on his pads and he flicks this fine. Fine enough that no fielder can get there. He's found his hands alright
length on the stumps, makes room to punch through cover
floated up outside off, stroked to point
flatter and shorter and quicker, stays back and punches to long-on
down the track and clips this through square leg
fuller, given some air, driven inside out through cover
flatter darting into him, punched easily to long-on
flatter on a length, he's coming down the track, gets to the pitch and pushes it through midwicket
tossed up outside off, goes down and sweeps it hard through midwicket
length outside off, stays back and cuts this through point
length on off, stays legside of it and punches through cover
flatter outside off and shorter, he was going down early to sweep, has to wait for it and just paddles it to short fine leg's right
punched to cover
142kph, half-volley and he climbs into a glorious cover drive! Just smashed it past cover's left
full and angled into middle, he pings this off his toes through square midwicket, lovely timing for two
141kph, good length, some width, he thrashes a square drive on the up to deep point
141kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he sits back and guides this to third man
143kph, back of a length on off, he's back and whipping this with the bottom hand through square leg
138kph, bouncer, bounces slowly wide of off and the square leg umpire calls wide on height. Might have been a bit stiff. It was tight
139kph, short into the ribs, he steps inside and pulls to fine leg. 50 off 38 balls for Smith. He has motored to that half-century.
tossed up on middle, he drives to long off
97kph, he steps outside leg early, Agarwal follows, he paddles this fine
low full toss, driven to long on
95kph, flatter on middle, he turns this to midwicket

a misfield at point gives up four! Jadeja with the error. It was short outside leg, Smith backed away and slapped it to backward point, it should have been stopped but Jadeja didn't get his hands low enough
lofted straight back over the bowler's head! Lovely shot. Didn't over hit it, just timed it and placed it and the outfield did the rest
short slower ball, 118kph, he tried to pull but it gripped and beat him for a lack of pace
131kph back of a length on off, he's back and tucking this behind square
121kph, slower ball cutter, full outside off, he pushes this gently to the cover-point gap
117kph, slower ball, good length, he defends into the on side but sends Smith back
131kph, fuller outside off, he whips this wide of long on and immediately calls two. Excellent running
120kph, slower ball banged in, he stands up and smacks a pull straight to deep midwicket
86kph, tossed up outside off, he tries to sweep but misses
quicker and flatter on middle, he's back and tucking this around the corner
advances to drive and gets a thick inside edge past leg! It runs away for two
powerful sweep forward of square! Leg break on middle, he got down early and placed this forward of square. He struck it well to find the gap
full on off, he drives to long off

top edged sweep goes behind square and half volleys into the rope! He didn't intent to get that in the air, he rolled the wrists on the sweep to get it safely behind square and it nearly went for six!
slower ball, he slices this high over cover and just got enough of it to clear the fielder running back
118kph slower ball wide of off, he reaches out and wristily turns this through square leg
short and wide, he cuts firmly but straight to backward point. Smith is annoyed at himself for not finding the gap
107kph, slower ball, he late cuts but can't beat Dhawan diving at backward point
Labuschagne sets up way outside leg, Hardik fires wide, Labuschagne reaches out and slaps it back to the bowler
117kph, slower ball bouncer, he tries to pull but misses
thumping cover drive! Half volley wide of off, Smith opened his chest and hammered it between cover and mid off and the fielders did not move as it rocketed past them
124kph, slower ball bouncer, Smith tried to lap scoop! He set up too early and it lobbed over his head
slower ball, 121kph, but too wide of off and called wide
142kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and gliding this to third man
full outside off, he square drives to deep point
threaded past cover again! Another full delivery on middle, he backed away and carved it between cover and mid off once more. Incredible batting
121kph, short wide slower ball, he hammers a cut, Jadeja makes a diving stop on the ring
118kph, slower ball and he square drives on the up through backward point!Staggering timing on the up and he placed it past the backward point and beat the sweeper
delicate late cut fine of short third man! Another slower ball wide of off, he sat back and just let it run off the face to find third man with the man inside the circle
142kph, good length, top of off, he defends
142kph, fuller length on off, he mistimes a drive to cover
glanced past short fine from outside off! Good length delivery on a fourth stump line, he waiting and using the wrists tucked it wide of short fine and it raced away to the rope
124kph, slower ball, he slog sweeps behind square to the man in the deep
88kph, leg break, he advances and drills a drive to straight long on and Labuschagne hares back for two
launched straight to the sightscreen! He danced out and thumped this gun-barrel straight and it hit the sightscreen hard
shorter length, he's back and tucking this to the circle at midwicket and they run brilliantly to pinch two
90kph, shorter length, he pushes this to wide long on and they push for two, Labuschagne slips at the striker's end and they call no
wide full toss, he advances and slaps a drive to deep cover
lopped up on leg, he drives to long on and Smith makes back-to-back centuries! Again off 62 balls. What an innings. He gets a standing ovation. That's his 11th in ODI cricket
he steps outside off and lap scoops while doing an army roll! Amazing shot to get it over short fine

edged and caught at short third man! This was a wide slower ball, he fell over trying to cut it, got a thick edge and it flew straight to short third man on the circle. Smith is furious but he gets a hug ovation as he walks off
hit in the helmet! Slower ball bouncer, it stops in the surface, he gets through the pull shot and it hits the right side of the helmet. He's OK.
slower ball, 110kph, wide of off, he whips to deep midwicket
112kph, slower ball, he tries to work through the leg side, he gets a leading edge that flies through backward point for two
134kph, full toss, he punches a drive down the ground
97kph, darted in, he skips out and drives on the up to long off
Maxwell sets up way outside leg, Jadeja delivers on middle, he whips this to deep forward square
99kph, fired outside off, he tries to sweep fine but gets hit on the pad well outside the line
tossed up he drives firmly to cover the fielder does well to make a rolling save
rank round arm fired down leg and Maxwell steps inside and pulls over short fine! He would be frustrated he didn't hit that for six
switch hit flies fine of short third man! This was quick outside off, he switched his feet to go over backward point, but didn't get that much bat on it, it runs away fine of short third man
Jadeja drops a sitter at long off! This was lofted straight to him, he cruised in and at waist high just spilled it, they get two
wide slower ball, he late cuts superbly through the gap past short third man! 50 for Labuschagne from 46 balls.
104kph, wide slower ball, he shuffles outside off to cut but misses. It bounced slowly off the surface
slower ball, 108kph, short, he mistimes a pull to deep midwicket
116kph, slower ball outside off, he tries to switch hit but gets hit on the pad outside off
slower ball, 119kph, this kicks off a length and Maxwell can't judge the pull shot. He got through it early
123kph, slower ball, short outside off, he mistimes a pull to long on

Maxwell should have been run out! Jadeja misses a direct hit. Maxwell hit it to him at cover and ran and gave up, he would have been miles out if Jadeja hit, no one was backing up in the ring so they get an overthrow
120kph, short slower ball, he backs away and slaps it awkwardly through cover-point for a couple
142kph, full half volley, he slices a drive with amazing timing through cover for two
full wide yorker, he slices this out to cover-point again
142kph, almost a yorker he someone squeezes this out behind point taking one hand off the bat at it runs away for four! This outfield is rapid. That was a good delivery
slower ball wide of off, he cuts firmly to deep point
slower ball, 120kph, outside off, he late cuts but straight to short third man
huge pull shot over square leg! 20 rows back! Short ball but chest high, he set himself early and with those fast hands thumped it way back
125kph, full and very wide, he reaches out and slices this very high over backward point but it holds in the wind and lands inside the rope. They run three
141kph, low full toss, he opens up and slices a drive to deep point
142kph, thigh high full toss, he pulls this behind square but doesn't time it
lasered over cover! It hits the fence on the full! What a shot. Slower ball wide and he throws the hands at it and nails it flat over cover.
139kph, short ball, he tries to pull but mistimes it through midwicket for one
144kph, yorker outside off, he tries to scoop, gets hit on the pad outside the line and they run a leg bye
145kph, cracking yorker, on middle, he could do nothing but dig it out to cover
low full toss, 142kph, he backs away and slices it past backward point, they get a comfortable two
144kph, low full toss, he mistimes a heave to midwicket
140kph, yorker outside off, he sits back and works this to deep midwicket
142kph, full outside off, he drills this hard to long off and calls two immediately, Jadeja is off balance and they get back easily
slower ball outside off, he mistimes a pull to deep midwicket
low full toss, he gets outside off and gets an inside edge onto pad
124kph, slower ball, he reverse sweeps Shami up and over short third man! Outrageous shot
he goes again with a reverse lap scoop! Insane! Fuller and quicker, he just turned the bat and ramped it up and over short third man again
141kph, full angled down leg, he backs away and clips this off this pads to deep midwicket for an easy two
brilliant conventional paddle! It was a good yorker, Labuschagne moved late and just got enough bat on it to paddle it fine of short fine leg
low full toss, he backs away and drives wide of mid off but can't beat the man
145kph, full toss, he shimmies outside off and glances this fine but straight to fine leg
caught at mid off! He picks out the man this time. It was a half volley in the slot, he tried to loft over mid off but nailed it flat and Agarwal takes the catch easily on the circle
142kph, full outside off, he punches a drive past cover for two to ensure Maxwell has the strike for the last over

Given caught behind! Maxwell reviews. It was full and straight, he tried to reverse lap scoop again and it looks like it just brushed the pad on the way through to Rahul! No hot spot on the bat. He missed it. The decision is overturned
missed at short third man! 50 for Maxwell off 25 balls. He sliced a top edge high to short third man, Shami backed back but got in a tangle and didn't get a hand on it. They run two
low full toss smacked just over Pandya at deep midwicket! Incredible power. It was close to a yorker but not quite and Maxwell taxed him with the bottom hand whipping it over midwicket
high full toss swatted into the Members! Like a baseballer at the plate, he got a delivery knee high and flushed over deep midwicket again
short and wide, he tries to uppercut but misses
full on leg, he backs away to have over midwicket but mistimes it to midwicket and they only get one
half volley on leg stump to start and nicely tucked away by Agarwal. Didn't try to over hit it, just timed it beautifully through midwicket. Excellent timing on that
back of a length going across him, drops his wrists and lets it go past
super shot. Agarwal's got his timing right from the start. Full outside off, going across him, low full toss and he just steers it through point with a horizontal bat
length on the stumps, punched back
length on the stumps again, better lines from Starc and he's pulled his length back too. Defended to point
back of a length targetting the ribs on off, stays behind it and defends calmly into the offside
what a start by Dhawan. Full outside off and he lashes it through cover with an easy, flowing cover drive
better length and line, back of a length and closer to off, gets up and defends towards point
back of a length again, going across him, he lets it go outside off
keeps it stump to stump on a length, pushed towards cover
keeps it tight, not a loose ball after that first one. On a length on off, and Dhawan can only defend
going across a bit but Hazlewood keeps the ball near his front pad and Dhawan pushes it to cover. Excellent over
yorker length almost on off, punched to cover
length outside off, chops it through point and a mis-field by Smith at point concedes a run
back of a length, nibbling around off, plops it down off an under-edge, trying to tap it towards point
strays on the pads that time, but it's still back of a length. Agarwal tucks it through midwicket
flowing drive to a ball that's fuller this time, outside off, but extra cover manages to stop it
good length on the stumps, defended from the crease
nice tight line outside off on a length, defensively pushed to point
slightly too straight that time, allows Agarwal to work this square on the legside
bouncer beats him. Dug in short and well targetted, on leg stump. Gets really big on him as he tries to pull. Ball flies past the grille and was too close to body to pull anyway
length outside off, pushes softly to mid-off and Warner sprints to his left and tumbles to stop the ball
back of a length on off, mis-field at point as it goes through him. Marnus the man there. He stayed on the back foot and punched it well, but that was straight to the man and should have been fielded
length outside off, going across a bit, pushes it to mid-on

mis-timed lofted drive but lands safe. Fuller outside off and Dhawan went for the big drive but it wasn't quite as full. Gets it higher on the bat than he would have wanted and the ball goes up in the air over mid-on.
length on the pads, flicked to fine leg
back of a length outside off, tapped down close to him towards silly point for a quick single

inside edge goes for four. Unlucky for Starc, nails a perfect yorker in front of middle, but Dhawan has managed to just jab his bat down in time for the ball to brush past the inside edge and go very fine
smashed. That was authoritative. Back of a length but lots of room outside off and he stands up to ride the bounce and carve it over the infield to the point boundary

another yorker goes for a boundary! Dhawan was more in control of this one though. Just inches away from being a perfect yorker on leg stump and he got his bat down to tap it fine, almost between his legs. Fine leg was too square to run around in time
length all, nudged towards square leg
he was making room but Hazlewood saw it and banged it in short while following him, Dhawan has to adjust and try the ramp but can't connect
outside edge. He's looking to flick it but it takes the edge and flies off to third man. Starc, who saw edges from him going to the fence last over, slides to his right and pulls off a good save
swatted with disdain. Slower ball gone wrong, pitches it way too short and it sits up for Dhawan, who rocks back and swivels to pull this through midwicket
fuller on the stumps, pushed softly towards cover for a quick single. overthrows with the fielder there, Finch I think, having a shy at the stumps
short ball down legside and Carey goes up in appeal but the umpire is signalling wide. Dhawan was looking to pull this but it went over his bat. Clear daylight between bat and ball
length on the stumps, defended to cover
peachy. Full outside off, there for the drive and he unfurls such a lovely one. Punch-drives it through extra cover. All timing and class
fuller on the stumps, punched past the bowler but mid-on is straighter and fields

and he threads the gap again. Agarwal's punch-drives don't have the same flourish that you associate with cover drives, but such pristine timing. Fuller outside off again and he comes on the front foot to bisect the field
length on middle now, nudged to midwicket
length outside off, nipping in, he jabs it back to the bowler
bouncer on off, he spotted it coming and ducked. But it's too high and will be a wide
fuller on off, punched to cover
length on middle and steered to short third man

falls just short of a diving Marnus at deep square. Didn't get on top of this bouncer while trying to pull, gets a top edge .Marnus was not near the ball but puts in a valiant effort running forward and to his left and diving forward, but the ball drops short
pushed into the legside

easy catch at midwicket. Slower ball possibly, because Dhawan was into his shot too early. Length around off, he was looking to whip it away. Plays it early and the ball loops up for a comfortable take in the circle
back of a length outside off, defended to cover on the back foot
length in the channel, lets it go
through him. Banged in on a hard length and nips in, Agarwal is playing inside the line of that and tried to run it down fine but beats his outside edge
back of a length outside off, more room this time, and he stays legside to punch through point
caught behind. Similar line to the first ball that beat him, kept it in the channel, banged it on a hard length and Agarwal gets a thin edge while looking to steer it fine. Super bowling
back of a length from wide of the crease, angling into him, jabbed to third man
length ball on a seventh stump line, Kohli's not interested in getting his bat anywhere near it
closer to off stump that time and Kohli waits and opens the face to steer it through point, but Maxwell does excellently to dive to his right and stop the ball
there's a bouncer now, but he ducks under it easily
backs away and hacks it over the in-field on the offside for four. He's expecting the short ball and he's decided to take it on by moving in his crease and creating room
bowler bluffed, the batsman didn't fall for it. Full ball on the pads to follow those two bouncers, Iyer stayed still and calmly flicked this through square leg
backing away again but Hazlewood knows he'll do that now and bangs it in short and directed at him backing away. Too close to his body to hack and he doesn't connect
fuller on the stumps, defended to cover
length ball on the stumps, looks like Iyer was hanging on the back foot for that one, adjusts quickly and defends it back down the pitch
fuller on off, driven to mid-off
length outside off, opens the face to steer it square, third man has to go to his right to field
another short ball, outside off, Kohli gets into position quickly and tries to unleash a pull, but the ball goes over bat as he connects only with air
fuller outside off, steered to backward point. Smith has a shy and hits the stumps direct, but that allows an overthrow
back of a length outside off, punched to backward point

short ball almost does him in again. He was a bit of a sitting duck there almost, as Cummins banged one in on target at middle stump. Moved back and across but could only fend it off. Luckily for Iyer, it went up till about head height only and dropped down quickly, and Cummins couldn't get to it in time for the return catch
fuller outside off, slashed to point
flat on the stumps, goes back and punches to long-on
flat outside off, stays legside of it and cuts through point
given some more air, gets drift too but it ends up on the pads and is worked square
length on the stumps, pushed towards cover and he sets off for a single but is sent back in time. Wisely so, the fielder swooped in and was letting loose a throw
drags it down too short and Iyer pounces on it with a fierce pull. Probably hit it too hard so lost some timing but it's in the gap at midwicket
another sharp short ball, outside off, but Kohli is equal to it and defends it toward point
length on off, moves across and uses wrists to tap it, but midwicket fields

top edge clears fine leg. Banged in short again outside off, Kohli moves across and takes him on with the pull shot. The ball was a bit too big on him though so he gets a bit of a top edge. Hit meatily enough to carry all the way

lbw appeal given but Kohli's gone up for a review straightaway. This looks close but he could be saved by an inside edge. And it's clear why he went for the review. Clear inside edge. Good length outside off nipping in, and he is beaten on the inside edge trying to drive. But he's still there
steered to point
another short ball, Kohli controls his pull well enough to keep it down and get a single to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, reaches for it and slaps it but can't beat cover
given air outside off again, Kohli gets that big front foot stride going, gets to the pitch and pushes to cover
uses his wrists this time to lash a drive to cover's left
finds the gap. Given room outside off, stays low and cuts with authority through backward point
fuller, comes on the front foot to punch it back to the bowler
glorious straight drive. Full on the stumps, leans forward and drives it straight back
length outside off, opens the face to glide to point
outside edge goes for four. In the channel and moving in, Kohli is stuck on the crease and plays inside the line, gets the edge but gets runs for it
back of a length, goes for the pull, ball didn't bounce as much goes to square leg off the bottom half of the bat
length ball on off, Iyer hanging back a touch again, but deals with it comfortably enough, patting it to mid-on
tossed up outside off, goes for the big drive but gets it on the bottom half of the bat and the ball rolls to cover
good length, comes on the front foot to get to the pitch and steers it through point
fuller, comes on the front foot to drive to cover
flatter on off, stays back and punches through cover
length outside off, stays legside of it and opens the bat face to steer, but can't beat short third man
too full, clipped off his toes through midwicket
108kph, slower ball, back of a length, he stands up and punches to long on
127kph, length ball wide of off, he square drives to deep point
123kph, back of a length, he advances and mistimes a drive to mid off who is on the circle
122kph, bouncer sails way over the head of Iyer and is called wide
113kph, slower ball, back of a length, he stands up and punches to long on
123kph, short ball, he pulls powerfully but straight to deep midwicket
120kph, short ball, he stood up and hammered a pull shot and Cummins makes an excellent stop at midwicket to save three runs
tossed up, he sits back and works to midwicket
tossed up, he dances down but gets a slight leading edge back to the bowler
darted into leg, he clips this to deep midwicket
round arm, flatter, 88kph, he sits back and punches back to Maxwell
89kph, angled into leg stump, he works this off his hip to deep backward square
87kph, drifting across, he charges and works this with the spin to long on
124kph, half volley, he smokes a drive to cover but the fielder is able to knock it down
full on leg, he clips firmly to long on
126kph, shorter and wider, he backs away to cut but misses
126kph, good length, fourth stump, he drives on the up to mid off
123kph, full outside off, he square drives to deep cover-point
127kph, low full toss, mistimed to long on
91kph, shorter length, he stands tall and punches to long on
drifting across Kohli, he's on the move trying to work to leg but gets a leading edge that runs wide of long on for two
shorter length, he's back and punching to long off
switch hit over point! Good shot. Smart option. No one back at point, he got the delivery he wanted outside off stump, switched his feet and smacked it over point
shorter length he stands up and drives of the back foot to long on
short again, he is back and pulling firmly to deep midwicket
tossed up, 91kph, on off, he defends, angling it to the gap at cover-point
tossed up outside off, he drives firmly to deep cover-point
top spinner pushed through, Kohli exposes his stumps and chops it to point
92kph leg break, he advances and drills a drive straight of long on and Cummins has to work hard to get to it
drifting into leg, he skips out and whips this firmly to deep midwicket
96kph, quicker leg break, good length, he's back and working this to midwicket
tossed up on leg, he skips down and drives to long on
flatter round arm, he drives on the up to deep long on
pulled with ease to the gap at square leg! Fractionally short, Kohli was back in a flash and smashing this into the gap between deep backward square and deep midwicket
flatter and shorter outside off, he clatters a cut straight to cover
arm ball, he sits back and late dabs this to third man. Delicate, skilful shot for two
shorter length, he's back and smacking this back at the bowler, Maxwell gets a hand down but they take a run on the ricochet
tossed up outside off, he advances and drives to deep cover
thumped over midwicket and wide of long on! Raw power. It was very full on leg, he flicked his hands through and hit it flat and hard over the man in close in the circle
top spinner on middle, he's back and working this behind square
short down leg, he pulls this past short fine to bring up a half-century! He's done that easy. He's starting to accelerate now Virat Kohli
91kph, tossed up outside off, he skips down and drives to long off
92kph, short wide leg break and it's called wide
96kph, flatter and quicker on middle, he drives on the up to long on

brilliant catch by Smith at midwicket! Henriques gets a wicket on return. This was a short slower ball, it stopped in the pitch, Iyer had sit and wait, he whacked a pull shot hard to midwicket, Smith was alert diving full stretch on the circle to his right pulled in a beauty. Really good catch
122kph, back of a length outside off, he is back and forcing this straight to cover
123kph, back of a length, fifth stump, he plays an elegant square drive off the back foot to deep point
126kph, fuller, tailing into middle, he drives towards long on but Smith whips across from midwicket to cut off the single
Kohli advances and drives a 111kph slower ball to long on
120kph, angled into the hip, he glances this neatly to fine leg
84kph, tossed up outside off, he eases a drive to deep cover-point
tossed up outside off, 86kph, he reaches out and drives to long off
88kph, looped wide of off, he square drives to deep cover-point
93kph, shorter leg break, he's giving room but forces this straight to cover
88kph leg break, he drives firmly to long off
quicker top spinner, 94kph, he's hurried, pushing back to the bowler
112kph slower ball outside off, he advances and stays leg side, driving to deep cover
124kph, angled into leg, he pushes this to midwicket and wants one but is rightly sent back
124kph, fuller, tailing into middle, he pushes on the front foot straight of mid on
124kph, half volley, he crushes a drive straight to deep cover-point
123kph, good length, top of middle, he works this straight to midwicket
125kph, speared full into middle, he clips this off his toes nicely but Smith makes a fabulous save at midwicket
flicked over fine leg into the crowd! Half volley outside leg, Kohli just picked it up with exquisite timing and it went 10 rows back at fine leg
140kph, full on leg, he works this with ease forward of square to the sweeper
139kph, fuller outside off, he drives off a thick outside edge slicing it with the angle through backward point
135kph, good length, top of off, he pushes this firmly to cover
129kph, slower ball, angled across the right-hander, he guides this with the angle to third man
cracking cut shot through cover-point! Short and wide, Rahul was sitting back and he thumped a cut shot forward of point. The sweeper was well behind but it wouldn't have mattered if he was infront!
pulled in the air just wide of fine leg! Short over leg, he got inside it and helped it on its way, Cummins was closing from fine leg but it was wide of him. Well placed
length slower ball, he charges and gets cramped, taken on the pad
115kph slower ball, back of a length, he mistimes a pull to midwicket
Kohli advances, 114kph, back of a length, he drives on the up to long on
126kph, back of a length on off, he gives room and cuts firmly to deep point
126kph full outside off, he pushes firmly to cover
142kph, fuller on off, he drives firmly to cover
140kph, half volley wide of off, he square drives firmly to deep point
140kph, angled into middle, he clips this beautifully off his pads but can't beat midwicket
131kph, cutter banged in, he's back and guiding this to backward point but can't beat Kohli
126kph, slower ball outside off, he sits back and runs this off the face to third man
143kph, full outside off, he square drives to deep point
120kph, short ball, he tries to pull and mistimes to midwicket, it nearly carried to Smith who is tight saving one
112kph slower ball, off cutter, he gets an inside edge onto pad, it rolls into the off side and Henriques zips across to stop the single
125kph, good length, on middle, he tries to drive to long on but can't beat Smith at midwicket
123kph, shorter on leg, he pulls with easer to fine leg
short ball, Kohli charges and pulls to midwicket, Smith again makes an excellent save at midwicket to save one
128kph, length ball, he drives on the up to cover
short and wide, he's back and cutting firmly but straight to backward point
130kph, slower ball, good length wide of off, he tries to square drive but misses
137kph, bouncer, well directed, he sways underneath it
wide full toss, he square drives through backward point, Labuschagne has a long chase from deep point and makes a good save
short and wide, he cracks a cut to deep point
sliced past backward point! Full and wide, Kohli opened the face and sliced it just past Smith at backward point and it raced away
107kph, short slower ball, he tries to pull but mistimes backward of square
131kph, back of a length, Kohli advances and drives on the up to long on
What a pull shot! Banged in short and Rahul nails this way back over square leg. It hit the concourse behind the lower level seats
back of a length, it skids low, he pulls with control behind square
112kph, back of a length on leg, he gives room to push this into point
107kph, good length outside off, he mistimes to cover
129kph, full on leg, he chips this high in the air over midwicket, Finch has a long chase from the circle but he does well to save one run
length ball gets punished over midwicket! He didn't nail it. It wasn't that short but off the front foot he pulled it high over midwicket and it bounces into the rope
cracked wide of third man! Too much width at 137kph, he thrashes the hands through it and it races away
slower ball, 127kph, it takes Rahul on the pad as he tries to work behind square, there's an appeal for lbw but it is way too high
140kph, back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease
133kph, leg cutter on off, he mistimes a drive back to the bowler
tossed up on a fifth stump line, he was giving himself a bit of room to slap this through cover, but can't time it and it trickles back past the bowler
tossed up on off, driven firmly from the crease through cover
imperious. A couple of steps down, a bit of room and he blasts this over extra cover and into the boundary. Just looks so dominant when he plays that
flatter and pulls the length back so Kohli stepping out can't quite get to the pitch, ends up pushing it to cover
googly, goes back and punches to mid-on
shorter and flatter, stays back and punches to long-on
down the track again, and this is short and wide, he slashes it through point
length on a fourth stump line, opens the face to drive through cover point
short ball on the stumps, doesn't bounce sharply, he swivels and pulls from rib height to deep square leg
big appeal for lbw, not given. Finch indicates height might be a problem and he's right. It jagged in and struck him on the thigh pad, he was looking to pull

Super catch by Henriques at midwicket. Kohli got out in a similar manner in the first ODI and Hazlewood has provided a huge breakthrough. Back of a length, Kohli unleashes a pull while advancing, timed much better than he had in the first ODI, but Henriques at midwicket dives to his left and is almost horizontal to the ground when he plucks out the ball. Hazlewood is pumped.
bouncer first up goes over his left shoulder as he tries to pull and misses
tossed up on off, drives from the crease to deep cover
flatter, keeps it outside off on a length, chopped to deep cover
fuller, driven to extra cover
nicely tossed up, dipping on him as it reaches him, patted into the offside for a quick single
flat and quick, he gets behind it and defends back down the pitch
tossed up wider outside off, comes on the front foot to drive to deep cover
punched to midwicket
back of a length on a seventh stump line, he tries to cut this but can't connect

was moving across but Hazlewood kept it well outside off and Hardik cramped for room to this back of length ball. Ends up half-edging, half-guiding it to third man. Bounced more than he expected, had to play it near his ribs
low full toss on off, one hand comes off the bat as he drives to deep point with an open bat face
short ball, he was expecting it perhaps, moved across and threw everything into a pull shot, but can't connect. Goes over his left shoulder
Pandya power. That's not such a bad ball but when he nails his shots, there's no stopping them. A touch too short and he swats it across the line - goes flat and hard, all the way over deep midwicket
angling into him on a length, pushed back down the pitch
full angling in on middle stump, steered to short third man. Smith's there and he dives to his left to stop the ball. He's unstoppable today is Smith
yorker on middle and off, mis-times his drive to mid-off
boom. Moves across to get inside the line to this short ball and pulls fiercely, sends it several rows back over deep square leg
back of a length outside off, steers to backward point. He's angry with himself, perhaps thinks he should have put that away better
fuller on the stumps, driven to deep cover
back of a length outside off, mis-times his pull to mid-on
chips over mid-off. Went inside out to this fuller one and well clear of mid-off, but not enough legs on it to stop Finch running back and pulling the ball in well before it reaches the fence
moves across and tries to smack a pull shot to the boundary but doesn't get the timing or placement quite right. Bounces down to deep midwicket
was moving across but the bowler keeps it on his front pad and Hardik can only nudge it away for a single
tried to ramp this but it was a slower bouncer outside off and he had to adjust to it, ends up getting such a soft touch it bounces before the keeper
bad ball and put away in style. brings up fifty for Rahul. Too short, sat up, Rahul rocked back and pulled this high and handsome over deep midwicket
bouncer down leg, he pulls it to fine leg
length ball outside off, no timing at all on that attempted slap, which trickles to extra cover
slower ball, dug into the pitch on a hard length. Loses his shape on the cut and under-edges it on the bounce to the keeper
that's just pure timing. Just a touch fuller outside off and he punches this over extra cover in the circle and to the boundary
moving across but Starc is on target, not giving him any room and he can only pat it back down the pitch from a length
clever bowling from Starc, slower bouncer well outside off. Rahul leaves it alone thinking it'll be a wide, but I think that was inside the tramline
length outside off, he's moving across and slashes this fiercely but can't beat extra cover
great bowling. He was moving across but the bowler still kept it wide outside off, and just inside the tramline. Pandya decides again reaching for it and potentially mis-hitting
full toss, this one is just beyond the line of control, so to speak, and it's a wide
and this one doesn't bounce as much as Hardik thought. Moving across, covers the line well to pull this, but the ball goes under the bat
fuller and still wide of off. Pandya stays still that time and launches into a booming drive, but only connects with air. This is superb from Cummins to a big-hitter like Pandya who is in form
length well wide of off stump, moving across again, throws his bat at it to crash through offside but he hasn't nailed a single shot this over. This one takes the under edge and bounces to Carey

and that is a sensational end to the over by Cummins. Slips in a full toss that's dipping a tad, I don't think Pandya was expecting that at all, ends up beaten once again while trying to punch it. Reacted late to the full toss
full outside off, driven to deep cover
fuller outside off, he's moving across again, manages to use wrists in a mini helicopter shot to long-on. Not really timed well
moves across again but this is also on a sixth stump line so ends up  not having too much room. Swats it to long-on
full toss in the channel again. Rahul's turn to be surprised by that and miss connecting. Aimed a big drive at it

nails it this time. Another full toss, Rahul backs away this time and flashes a powerful cover drive that travels flat and hard. Ashton Agar at the cover boundary dives to his right but the ball's too quick for him and actually goes all the way
length ball on leg stump, misses the flick. Was aiming to go over fine leg, but the ball bounces off pad to the keeper
yorker length outside off, he gets bat down horizontal to steer it. Flies to Zampa's right at short third man but he puts in a dive and gets a palm to it. can't really call it a drop
back of a length outside off, slashed to deep point

back of length on the stumps, Pandya doesn't try to hit it too hard this time, so even though he's not hit it very fluently, he's timed it well enough to find the deep square leg boundary with his pull
full outside off, gets low and drives to deep point

chipped in the air but not in Finch's reach at point. that seemed to really stick in the pitch, on a length outside off, he was too early into his cut, it ballooned off the upper edge. Finch opts to be safe rather than try a difficult catch with the game all but sewn up
length outside off, cuts to cover
flat and well wide of off, he chops it to deep extra cover
down the track and clears long-off. Wasn't hit cleanly, but had enough on it to go just over the long arms of Mitchell Starc at long-off.

dropped by Finch running backwards from point. Went down on his knee to crash this through the offside, gets a top edge that swirls over point. The wind wouldn't have made it easy as Finch running back can't even lay hand on it

and he's finally caught. Hazlewood at short third man has a very easy take. After being nearly caught for two balls in a row, Rahul goes off the third, a routine top edge lobbing up to the fielder. Was swiping across the line again but this was nicely flighted and dipped, got the bounce too which ended up taking the top edge
flatter outside off but very full, so he sweeps it hard to deep square leg
length on off, slaps it through cover
short ball outside off, he goes deep and nails a pull shot that beats square leg to his left
goes deep in his crease again but can't get underneath this full ball and can only mis-time it to mid-off. Oh he's overstepped, so free hit coming up.
swing and a miss to the free hit. Excellent bowling by Cummins. Full ball and wide outside off. Pandya swings hard but connects only with air
fuller outside off, squeezed to cover. Not timed well
length ball on the stumps, slower one, but Jadeja flicks it comfortably through square leg
fuller, punched to long-on
tried the wide yorker outside off but went too far across and it's a wide
back of a length on leg stump, slows it up again, Jadeja pats it towards square leg and they sprint two

holes out to deep midwicket. He had to go for the big hits, but Australia have strangled him. This was dug into the pitch back of a length and he was cramped for room, tried to pull. Couldn't control it. oh wait a minute, it's a no ball. He's overstepped. Pandya stays

boom. This is the Jadeja who was in prime IPL hitting form. Full toss, low outside off, a yorker gone wrong. Those are not so easy to hit but Jadeja has the room to baseball slug it over midwicket. well over.
back of a length and closer to off, doesn't time his pull but it's in a gap at midwicket so they get two
bang goes Jadeja. Another yorker attempt, this one was outside off and not as wide, but Jadeja clears his front leg and smashes it way over square leg. Powerful strikes these
goes for the wide yorker outside off and gets away with one just about on the tramline. Jadeja is disappointed, he thought that should be a wide
another wide and full ball, he's more prepared for it this time and reaches out to stroke it, gets an inside edge that goes to short fine leg
backs away, Starc follows him but bowls a half volley instead of a yorker on the pads, and Pandya flicks it off his toes to deep midwicket.
spliced to extra cover. This was again full and wide outside off, Jadeja was looking to go over the legside again but gets an outside edge that loops up for an easy catch

two in two for Cummins. Caught at long-off this time. Length ball outside off, he was giving himself some room and tried to crash it through the offside but got it only off the toe-end. Straight to the fielder.
hat-trick ball goes way down legside for a wide
length outside off, negotiated towards point
length ball, rears up towards the batsman while nipping into him, fended off awkwardly into the offside from near his midriff
bouncer goes over his head and it's been called a wide
length on off, pushed through cover
fullish on the stumps, clipped to long-on
swing and a miss. Big swing. Length ball going across him outside off. He was looking to send it to downtown Sydney
Maxwell calls for it and takes the return catch. Down the track, swats it with a cross bat, top edge goes straight up. Bowler settles under it and takes it calmly.
length on middle and leg, tapped back
fuller, driven to long-off
length on the stumps, goes right back and defends
length on the stumps, punched back to the bowler's right
leg-break on a length, goes back and punches to long-on

googly, he didn't read it at all and trapped right in front. He was shaping to push into the offside with the ball pitching on off, but it spun back in. He's standing fairly deep too, and struck below the knee roll so it's as plumb as it gets. Crashing into middle stump
tossed up, he comes on the front foot and drives, inside half of the bat to midwicket
fuller, and he covers the line while tapping it to midwicket
attempted slog across the line, a top edge goes clear of midwicket
flat on leg stump, moves across and clips it backward of square
tossed up on off, big stride out and smashes it coolly to the long-off boundary
flatter and fuller, drills it powerfully and very straight but Starc has moved straighter so it's only a single
wider outside off, tries to slog it again, but it goes to cover off the toe-end
nice looking shot, goes on one knee and square drives it through cover point
tossed up and he drives to long-on. Australia win by 51 runs
